answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If cellulitis is not responding to antibiotics, then you need to find out your diabetes status

question: I've had cellulitis infection in my L. lower leg and ankle for 3 1/2 weeks. First I was given Keflex for 7 days.  I was   told to elevate the foot and wear compression socks.   I did both, but not enough. Infection mostly went away in lower leg.  But TONIGHT there is still some pooling in my ankle.    THE ANKLE   EXCRUCIATINGLY ITCHES more than ever before and is painful around the ankle all the time. I don’t know if it’s healing, and fear it is getting worse. What should I do?(Additionally, for last 2 months there is pain in BOTH ANKLES   only on WALKING or STABDINBG IN PLACE. I don’t know if this is from venous insufficiency or an extension of arthritis in my knees which I have had for exactly 2 years.  How can I overvcome this  longer term pain on walking? )
title: How does CELLULITIS end?
